message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the double replacement reaction that occurs when a solution of potassium hydroxide is mixed with a solution of copper(II) sulfate? What is the precipitate formed during this reaction?
message_2:
When a solution of potassium hydroxide (KOH) is mixed with a solution of copper(II) sulfate (CuSO4), a double replacement reaction occurs. The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 KOH (aq) + CuSO4 (aq) â†’ K2SO4 (aq) + Cu(OH)2 (s)

The precipitate formed during this reaction is copper(II) hydroxide (Cu(OH)2), which is a blue solid.
